author: UK Department for Business, Innovation & Skills

organization.description: A group for anyone interested in open data related to Civil Society (voluntary, civic and social organisations). Things to do: 1. Join the Civil Society Open Data Interest Group 2. Subscribe to the Civil Society Open Data Email List 3. Add datasets to the Civil Society Open Datastore (here) What is Civil Society? "Civil Society is composed of the totality of voluntary civic and social organizations and institutions that form the basis of a functioning society, as distinct from the force-backed structures of a state (regardless of that state's political system) and commercial institutions of the market." Wikipedia
organization.title: Civil Society
organization.name: civil-society

name: uk-trade-union-membership-statistics
notes:
The latest national statistics on trade union membership for the United Kingdom produced by the Department for Business, Innovation & Skills were released on 30th April 2010 according to the arrangements approved by the UK Statistics Authority.
 

Trade Union Membership 2009 uses the Labour Force Survey to provide an estimate of the density of trade union membership for all UK employees and all UK workers. Additionally, estimates of trade union densities are published for age, gender, ethnicity, income, major occupation, industry, full and part-time employment, sector, nation and region. The report also provides information on union presence in workplaces and whether an employees pay and conditions are affected by collective agreement.
title: UK Trade Union Membership Statistics
